section2.p: &xep0257; defines similar mechanisms as this document. But this specification makes deliberately the following changes:

ul.li: Using certificate signing requests instead of certificates
Cert names do not need to be unique
Listing certificates does include a last used timestamp
No way to disable the certificate
All (currently three) mechanisms can be implemented individually

section2.topic: Protocol for adding a X.509 Certificate

example.caption: Client Uploads an X.509 Certificate Signing Request.
Server responds to an X.509 Certificate Signing Request.

section2.topic: Determing Support for Adding a X.509 Certificate
section2.p: If the server supports adding a X.509 certificate, it MUST advertise the fact by include the feature 'urn:xmpp:ccm2:add-cert:0'

section2.topic: Protocol for listing all X.509 Certificates

example.caption: Client Requests List of X.509 Certificates
Server Sends List of Known X.509 Certificates

section2.example: <iq type='result' to='hamlet@shakespeare.lit/denmark' id='2'> <list-of-certficiates xmlns='urn:xmpp:ccm2:list-certs:0'> <x509certificate last-used=''> <name>Mobile Client</name> <x509cert> ... </x509cert> <users> <resource>Phone</resource> </users> </x509certificate> <x509certificate last-used=''> <name>Laptop</name> <x509cert> ... </x509cert> </x509certificate> <x509certificate> <name>Desktop</name> <x509cert> ... </x509cert> </x509certificate> </list-of-certificates> </iq>
section2.p: Note that the certificate for 'Desktop' was never used, since the certificate has no last-used timestamp attribute.

section2.topic: Determing Support for Listing all Certificates
section2.p: If the server supports listing all X.509 certificate, it MUST advertise the fact by include the feature 'urn:xmpp:ccm2:list-certs:0'

section2.topic: Protocol for adding a X.509 Certificate
section2.example: <iq type='set' from='hamlet@shakespeare.lit/denmark' id='revoke'> <revoke-certificate xmlns='urn:xmpp:ccm2:revoke-cert1'> <fingerprint hash='TODO'>[CERT FINGERPRINT IN HEX(?)]</name> </revoke-certificate> </iq>

section2.topic: Determing Support for Revoking a X.509 Certificate
section2.p: If the server supports adding a X.509 certificate, it MUST advertise the fact by include the feature 'urn:xmpp:ccm2:revoke-cert:0'
